alert.note: Alert for Allen; Barren; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 2:13AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT MONROE...SOUTHEASTERN ALLEN AND SOUTHEASTERN BARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 200 AM CDT... At 112 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles south of Glasgow to 13 miles north of Lafayette to near Scottsville to 7 miles northeast of Westmoreland. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Tompkinsville, Gamaliel, Fountain Run, Oak Forest, Gum Tree, Maynard, Austin, Nobob, Lamb and Flippin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
